intro: Hieracium lachenalii subsp. pseudodiaphanum, commonly known as the translucent hawkweed, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish to greenish flower heads. The subspecies is distinguished by its translucent, thin leaves that give it a unique appearance. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
